title: Apple Car to enter production by 2020, report claims | Trusted Reviews
description:
![apple
carplay](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Apple is to start producing its much-mooted electric car as soon as 2020, a
new report has revealed.**

Citing people ‘with knowledge of the matter’,
[Bloomberg](http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-02-19/apple-said-to-
be-targeting-car-production-as-soon-as-2020) has claimed the Cupertino-based
tech firm will make its first foray into the automotive industry in just five
years time.

It’s worth noting that a five-year timeframe is typical for other automotive
manufacturers developing a car.

The [iCar](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-news-rumours-
driverless-price-release-date-electric) rumour mill was in overdrive yesterday
as a lawsuit revealed [Apple was facing allegations over employee-
poaching](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-rumours-continue-as-
company-reportedly-poaches-battery-specialists) from an electric car battery
manufacturer called A123.

According to the company, Apple is guilty of unlawfully nabbing top-level
engineers to build its own battery division.

The [iPhone 6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/iphone-6-review) maker also
reportedly attempted to hire battery experts from LG Chem, Samsung, Panasonic,
and Toshiba.

What’s more, Apple has also been found to have [hired a host of Tesla
staff](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-talk-intensifies-as-more-
automotive-experts-sign-on), lending further credence to the suggestion that
Apple is working on an electric vehicle.

But could Apple realistically enter the automotive industry? Well it certainly
has the spare capital to try. Last quarter saw the tech giant post [a world
record profit of $18 billion](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-
smashes-its-all-time-record-with-74-5m-iphone-sales), while the firm’s cash
reserves are known to be in excess of $178 billion (£116bn).

It’s also important to remember that Apple typically avoids being the first to
market for various product categories. Other companies beat Apple to the punch
with smartphones, tablets, portable music players, and smartwatches.

This means that Apple could look to rectify mistakes made by Tesla and other
electric car manufacturers. Tesla plans to launch a new electric car in 2017.

Apple has already dipped its tow in the automotive market too, having launched
its [CarPlay dashboard interface](https://www.trustedreviews.com/apple-
carplay-review). It’s likely an actual Apple Car would see this system
integrated.
